isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - WHEELS, RIMS AND TIRES - TIRE CARE

svcproc.title: INSPECTION
svcproc.para: A regular program of tire inspection is essential for the prevention of rapid air loss failures. At a minimum, tires should be inspected at the time of the regular preventive maintenance checks.
In any tire inspection routine, tires should be inspected for the lowing conditions. If any are found, the tire should be removed and repaired, retreaded or scrapped as the condition indicates.

item.para: Any blister, bump or raised portion anywhere on the surface of the tire tread or sidewall (other than a bump made by a repair). These indicate the start of internal separation.
Any cut that reaches to the belt or ply cords, or any cut that is large enough to grow in size and depth.
If any stone or object is held by a tread groove and is starting to drill into the tread base, remove the object.
Look for skid spots and irregular wear conditions.

svcproc.para: Proper tire inflation, tire loads, and road speeds are important determining factors governing tire mileage, and also affect steering ease and maneuverability. How much these factors affect tire wear is illustrated in the paragraphs which follow.
